name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.

flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

strengths: Exceptional 100 HP makes it difficult to knock out in one hit
Take Down's 80 damage can OHKO most Stage 1 Pokémon and damage Stage 2s
Flamethrower's 50 damage is respectable for 3 energy
Works well with Fire Energy acceleration strategies
Only one Stage 1 evolution makes it relatively easy to set up
Three retreat cost makes it resistant to Gust of Wind switching strategies
weaknesses: Water weakness is significant in a meta with Blastoise and rain Dance
Flamethrower's energy discard reduces sustained attacking capability
Take Down's 30 self-damage hastens its own knockout
High energy requirements (3-4 energy) slow down initial setup
Three retreat cost makes it difficult to switch out once active
Vulnerable to Pokémon Center which removes all damage but also all energy
counters: Blastoise with Rain Dance - Can tank hits and OHKO with Hydro Pump
Gyarados - Water typing and high HP make it a major threat
Hitmonchan - Can deal significant damage before Arcanine sets up
Pokémon Center - Removes Take Down self-damage but also energy
Energy Removal effects - Cripples high energy requirement attacks

description: Arcanine is a powerful Stage 1 Fire-type Pokémon with an impressive 100 HP, making it one of the most durable non-holographic Stage 1 Pokémon in the Base Set. Its evolution from Growlithe creates a formidable Fire-type attacker that can deliver devastating damage while maintaining solid defensive stats. As a Legendary Pokémon in the lore, Arcanine brings both thematic appeal and competitive viability to Fire decks.
competitiveHistory: Arcanine saw moderate play in the early Base Set meta as a solid Fire-type option that didn't require the complex setup of Charizard. However, it was generally overshadowed by more efficient attackers in top-tier competitive play. Its 100 HP and 80 damage output were respectable, but the self-damage and energy discard mechanics limited its appeal in tournament settings where consistency was paramount.

rulings.ruling: You must be able to discard 1 Fire Energy card from Arcanine in order to use Flamethrower. If you cannot pay the cost, you cannot use the attack.
The 30 damage Arcanine does to itself is not considered damage from an opponent's Pokémon, so effects that prevent or reduce opponent's damage do not apply.
Defender reduces all damage done to the Pokémon it's attached to, including self-damage from Take Down.
The self-damage from Take Down is applied after the attack resolves, so Arcanine would knock itself out if it has 30 or fewer HP remaining.
